item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, January 31, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenAI O3-Mini (389 points | 397 comments)
2. Bypass DeepSeek censorship by speaking in hex (172 points | 115 comments)
3. Elite on the 6502: The original 6502 assembly source, heavily commented (64 points | 5 comments)
4. GenAI Art Is the Least Imaginative Use of AI Imaginable (68 points | 41 comments)
5. Add "fucking" to your Google searches to neutralize AI summaries (116 points | 34 comments)
6. FBI, Dutch police disrupt 'Manipulaters' phishing gang (78 points | 18 comments)
7. Show HN: Uscope, a new Linux debugger written from scratch (147 points | 65 comments)
8. FurtherAI (YC W24) Is Hiring engineers and researchers to build Vertical AI agents ( | hide)
9. Theoretical limitations of multi-layer Transformer (58 points | 6 comments)
10. Paris P2P Festival and Hackathon (24 points | 3 comments)
11. Zusie – My Relay Computer (87 points | 25 comments)
12. The Tensor Cookbook (39 points | 6 comments)
13. Fixing E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial for the Atari 2600 (2013) (83 points | 27 comments)
14. Shell-ish scripting in Go with ease (79 points | 21 comments)
15. When Greedy Algorithms Can Be Faster [C++] (13 points | 1 comment)
16. Living with Nausea: My Story in Six Charts (87 points | 32 comments)
17. Better Know a Ruby Thing: Singleton Classes (59 points | 4 comments)
18. Large Language Models Think Too Fast to Explore Effectively (51 points | 6 comments)
19. Images reveal exocomets around nearby stars (75 points | 5 comments)
20. Instagram and Facebook Blocked and Hid Abortion Pill Providers' Posts (122 points | 57 comments)
21. Apple files emergency motion to become defendant in US vs. Google [pdf] (311 points | 327 comments)
22. Real-time, river sections downstream of sewage discharges from storm overflows (38 points | 12 comments)
23. How will Australia's under-16 social media ban work? We asked the law's enforcer (18 points | 10 comments)
24. MillenniumDB: Property graph and RDF engine, still in development (57 points | 22 comments)
25. Hydro: Distributed Programming Framework for Rust (248 points | 43 comments)
26. Taking a $15 Casio F91W 5km underwater (301 points | 78 comments)
27. Show HN: voidDB – A transactional key-value DB written in Go for 64-bit Linux (49 points | 13 comments)
28. US government agency argues that money isn't property–so it can take yours (122 points | 71 comments)
29. How to Train an AI Image Model on Yourself (152 points | 31 comments)
30. Show HN: Ldump – serialize any Lua data (88 points | 39 comments)
